subject: 1225p 6/17 Update:Spacewalk begins
body:
1225p 6/17 Update:Spacewalk begins



=================================

CBS NEWS STS-117 STATUS REPORT: 69
Posted: 12:25 PM, 6/17/07

By William Harwood
CBS News Space Analyst

Changes and additions:

   SR-65 (06/15/07): Spacewalk ends; solar array successfully retracted; news briefing; combining takes
   SR-66 (06/16/07): Russians activate revived computers; continue tests and troubleshooting
   SR-67 (06/16/07): Two more computers recovered after additional bypass work
   SR-68 (06/17/07): Crew awake; final spacewalk on tap
   SR-69 (06/17/07): Spacewalk begins

=================================

12:26 PM, 6/17/07, Update: Spacewalk begins

Floating in the Quest airlock module, astronauts Steve Swanson and Pat Forrester switched their spacesuits to internal battery power at 12:25 p.m. to officially begin a six-and-a-half-hour spacewalk, the fourth and final planned excursion for the Atlantis astronauts.

This is the 87th spacewalk devoted to space station assembly and maintenance since construction began in 1998 and the 10th so far this year. Going into today's EVA, 48 U.S. astronauts, 15 Russian cosmonauts, two Canadians and four astronauts representing Japan, Germany, France and Sweden had logged 530 hours and 34 minutes of EVA time building and maintaining the space station. The three previous shuttle EVAs by Forrester, Swanson, Jim Reilly and Danny Olivas total 21 hours and 29 minutes.

The primary goal of today's spacewalk is to finish activating a solar array rotary joint on the newly installed S3 truss to permit the outboard right-side S4 arrays to track the sun. The astronauts also plan to carry out a variety of other station assembly tasks. See the 8:39 a.m. status report for complete details.
